i-U6Gjm-s-l8UeSpd2akBQ.text: The passion of several entrepreneurs, who has worked in various sectors including F&B, advertising, hotels and even in fitness lead to the formation of an industrial-chic cafe called My Awesome Cafe. Most of them, including the owner Franck Hardy, has brought their expertise in working in restaurants, cafés and hotels over (and yes some even worked in Michelin-star restaurants / cafés before!).Located below the creative agency Mangham Gaxiola, it occupies the what previously is Chung Hwa Free Clinic and specializes in all-day breakfast, salads, sandwiches, coffees, teas, beers and liquor. They are also the only place in Singapore to sell Mexican Coca-Cola for the long term (read: Coca-Cola with Cane Sugar! The first being Omakase Burger but was only available for a limited time)The food menu is rather diverse!And the drinks menu! (they have Mexican Coca-Cola here!)The Croissant with Scrambled Eggs and Smoked Salmon ($8++) is easily one of the better tasting breakfast food out there. The croissant is filled with strips of cheese and the smoked salmon, which was smoked to the right texture and taste. The scrambled eggs, however, tasted slightly more like an omelette instead but still maintains its moist texture.The coffee served here are blends made from Columbian, Brazilian and Sumatran beans. The Latte ($4.50++) is full bodied and maintains the strong taste of the roasting process. Anyone who does not like bitterness may not like this even as the right amount of milk is added into the coffee.In overall, this place will surely attract the crowds with their passion and patriotism to the food and service served here. If you are around the CBD / Tanjong Pagar / Telok Ayer area, why not pop by this place? I know I would, and will try the Mexican Coca-Cola the next time round!

73dkQFw5FfKD1QEiC5taIg.text: I like this place. It definitely has its kinks to be worked out - every single [3] visit something on mine or my friends' orders has been wrong. But when pointed out the issue is always quickly resolved. People make mistakes - it's all in how you handle them, I say. The salads are great for lunch or a light dinner, though on the pricey side ($15++, addt'l $3 for cheese on the My Awesome Salad making it $18++). Still tasty enough for me to order the salad on every visit, I just can't make this a regular weekly stop for lunch.The happy hour specials are good for the CBD in my opinion (somewhere ~$35 for a bottle of wine, if memory serves, and something for beer and bubbly too). I wish you didn't have to queue up by the kitchen in order to pay at the end, as I feel massively in the way of the staff running back and forth with dishes of food which I could knock into. Not sure I can think of a more efficient process given the layout (and it does cut down on the time to pay as there's no need to flag down a server to get your bill) - just something for the cafe to consider.

0QmBuf2BuC0Dkvpm6eex0w.text: Good lasagna, meatballs and salad. The cheese plate was a big disappointment though. Lots of bread but not much else. Great atmosphere though. Food 3*, atmosphere 5*.

-wx0mO3zSCckwQ66owrm6Q.text: This place has cool lights and figurines resembling Ultraman. That's about it.  Their sandwiches for lunch are bland, at 13 a pop -- stingy with meat or salmon and are dry. Drinks are overpriced. They price a $5 can of boddington ale from coldstorage at $18. They forgot orders. Same experience as prior reviewer that the proprietor does a good job but the other waiters were a disaster. They could do so much better if they improved the food quality, expanded the menu, added better beers and wines to their selection, and dropped their current crop of waiters. 2 out of 5 for food, 4 out of 5 for atmosphere, 1 for service.

72prsCN18llMKkuKlaXoRw.text: A phenomenal Telok Ayer Neighborhood Cafe where the food is fresh, healthy, and excellent.  Frank, the managing owner, is always around to great customers with his warm and sincere demeanor. Places like this are rare and special.

ioWuGJzwh5uI_sVZbCvfqQ.text: Not to sure if it could be considered value for money apart from the cute decor. The food quality is decent but nothing to rave about. Service is good and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Prices.
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Dessert sampler -  bread pudding, brownie, pineapple and banana upside down cake smothered in cream.

Il1plaiI0IQ-myyscXjd_Q.text: Ordered a croissant + scrambled eggs + ham & cheese.Partner had the same with smoked salmon.So bad. Scrambled eggs were so watery that it made the croissant soggy... Will not be returning

4CtZAZwWNST7YjO_rjM2ww.text: I was on my way to Chinatown and needed food and to escape some pending rain so I stopped in. I thought the food was a little bit expensive, but it was a great lunch. The meal had a very light European feel to it. I had the ham sandwich which was served open face on baguette with a piece of very good ham on each slice of bread. The side salad was very nice and the yogurt & granola with pin alp slices seemed odd, but really was a nice side / ending to the meal. I had a great cup of tea as well.If I would have realized how close I was to Chinatown, I might have passed this place up for some cheaper fare, but I'm glad that I didn't.

-AKooqqm4XRWq1we2-kRkA.text: This cafe is very cool! Food is better than I expected, My Awesome Salad is very impressive, delicious indeed! Beef burger is also good, large portion, full of cheese. Juice is better than coffee. Decor and the service are also nice! Will definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

73JZRB_qZtu_ETFukmBEEw.text: Not so awesome experience for me and my friend. In fact it was awful. Their menu is ridiculously complicated, it's almost as if you'd have to solve a puzzle to get a meal, but not even a fun one because the food was terrible. My friend got a cold salad instead of the sandwich form he asked for. When he asked the waiter to change it, their suggestion was to put the salad inside some bread and call it a day! My acai icecream tasted like dirt. The beer was ok but I had better. What was worse, when we asked for the manager, he came and didn't even know what was in the menu. I'm surprised people come here, it's a hot mess.

X-2p-AjBCFzZEulxPLS1fA.text: The Good:  :: it's a local business  :: great ambiance. very casual and fun without being obnoxiously, overly trendy. love it that they kept the original outside clinic markings and signage!  :: service is friendly, fast, and efficient  :: lots of seating. i recommend, though, that you sit closest to the street to allow you for some fun people-watching  :: they take multiple forms of payment  :: food is very very delicious and healthy. i can't recommend the smoked duck breast enough! perfectly done, so tender, and so flavorful. if duck isn't your thing, they have plenty of other offerings that will satisfy your palette.   :: cannot recommend enough any of their fresh-squeezed juices. the watermelon juice, for example, is extremely refreshing and has no added sugar. my personal favorite!The Bad:  :: noneThe Ugly:  :: noneWould I go back? Most certainly yes! It's now one of my go-to's while I'm out here in Singapore. This place is IN.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. front of the restaurant

iq_DFn66p2dPvbGu4Uvrbg.text: I had what was probably the greatest salad ever here. My Awesome Salad is packed with proteins (smoked salmon, chicken, ham) and it comes with half an avocado and a bread with pesto. It was so good because it had everything I love on a salad (meat)! The price would be a bit steep for a salad, but since it has that much meat on it I was willing to pay the price. I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded at all and I didn't feel too awkward because there were other solo diners there besides me. It's a nice casual spot to get something good to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My Awesome Salad

56FshHFl474PXyTwE_pYKw.text: There are many awesome things to point out, from the excellent customer service to the fresh, delicious dishes. We tried the awesome breakfast, and awesome sandwich, and both were equally yummy and satisfying! Freshly squeezed juices and coffees were also on point! By day it's a cool cafe inside an old Chinese medical hall, and by night it becomes a chilled bar with reasonably priced drinks (by sgp standards anyway) I see why they have regulars coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

qjicoxhzyFoEvXujELCU8Q.text: Do not go during lunch hour on weekdays. The decibel level of this cafe will make your ears feel as though they got punched by fists.Also, the menus are almost illegible because they are in a tiny font size with many words packed tightly together, and the ink looks as if it's been half rubbed off by many people flipping through it. REPRINT YOUR MENUS and use more white space so that your menus are legible.The pesto is really good, so if you like pesto, I guess you can come here.There are options here for vegetarians and vegetarians who do not eat eggs.Make a reservation because this place is packed.There is no toilet paper in the toilet.Water is self-serve.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. This is an "Awesome Sandwich" (vegetarian version). Yep, hipster sandwiches are not two slices of bread kiapped together, but 8 pieces.

o3SWIBz5O00RYuLjEpV57Q.text: Atmosphere is pretty cool with a good vibe. I was there after work hours and definitely pretty chill and lots of expats just hanging out.Good beer and drink selection and the food was okay and not bad. I do appreciate their salads which are a decent size and have a whole half avocado which is pretty good. Duck confit roulettes was okay. Chicken lasagna was ground chicken and a lot of cheese. Still decent though. Service was okay but could've been improved since it seemed like the waitress was very frazzled because it was a little busy and didn't seem very attentive. Tip: make reservations if you're looking for a larger party size Tip 2: you can grab your own water cups

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

vOgkxNzBVAlspuyuqCqmsw.text: So many wonderful options on the menu!Really enjoyed the salad with avocado, almonds, salmon and capers. Everything is really fresh, healthy and delicious. Excited to come back and try something else before I leave Singapore!

X3NkheyWzmBUw2fyD7o3LQ.text: Great healthy food with wifi. Loved the $6.50 yogurt bowl with frozen or fresh fruit. Add honey for some extra sweetness!

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Breakfast menu before 12! Great prices and delish

jrawr-i9I93FevatnFMrXQ.text: I just realised the existence of My Awesome Cafe 5 mins from my office a few days ago and decided to give it a try today.  Was not really expecting a lot because of its name but well.. it's pretty good and I really enjoyed the food there.After eating a lot of crap this week (think sichuan food, Korean Fried Chicken) my body was screaming for a salad so I ordered the Awesome Vegetarian Salad.  Basically it's a platter of greens, tomatoes, grilled red bell pepper, avocado, boiled egg in a light vinaigrette dressing. Everything no the plate was perfect and just the way I like them to be, very very fresh.  Oh and you get to top it with a few pieces of brie or goat cheese. The pesto on the slice of bread that came with the salad was also super yummy!  We also ordered the acai, healthy super food dessert alternative, it's basically acai berries beaten and blended into a sorbet like texture, refreshing and delicious.  The price is not cheap but is completely justifiable by the high quality of the ingredients. I will definitely go back to check out their other offerings like their sandwiches and shakes.  The place gets filled up pretty quickly during lunch time so get there early.  Some nice outdoor roadside seats where u can enjoy your food while people watching. The decor is pretty interesting too as it occupies the former site of the Chung Hwa Clinic and they have retained the sign.  Inside the vibe is undoubtedly industrial.  Although it actually makes the places looks less genuine (thanks to all the fake heritage stuff around the shophouse area) and lowered my expectations for the food. But i guess don't judge a book by its cover?

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

Hy0ZasD-ipuc-7pRCI6wqw.text: My Awesome Café is so awesome, how can we not be one of the first to review this awesome café?Ok, jokes aside, the Chinese-y shopfront might fool passer-bys into thinking that it is a Chinese medicinal shop. Upon closer inspection, it is anything but. Expertly placed assorted knick-knacks and lit with rainbow-coloured lantern lamps, My Awesome Café's eclectic factor ranks high.Food-wise, the Chicken Lasagna didn't quite hit the spot as the portion was a tad too small. Try the Organic Watermelon Juice for a refreshing drink or the Awesome Coconut Ice Cream - great for cooling down in Singapore's hot weather.Choose from a couple of square tables or opt for a high table-top to do your work. Almost every table has a power socket close by and their Wi-Fi signal is pretty strong. Our planned 2 hour stint turned into a 5 hour affair! It can get pretty quiet on a Sunday night, given that the surrounding areas are office buildings, but hey we are not complaining! A great spot for work or for a chill night out with buddies.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Awesome shop front view
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

HI4c67qXh8H880sFRh3ugw.text: The food was 3 out of 5. We went for breakfast and the the options were very limited. Toast with cheese and bacon was tasty. Unfortunately the service was brutal. It wasn't very busy, maybe 50% full. Took forever to order, they forgot to bring out entire our order and brought the bill before complete meal was brought to us. The server dropped food off at the table and bolted, couldn't ask her for anything. Such a bummer because it is a cute spot.

cVwFTNwPIbAzpSvXSoXNvQ.text: I had an amazing chicken lasagna followed by a pineapple turnover and accompanied by melon juice. The service was great and the vibe very relaxed. I would highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

Zif--MG4t3REXri7MT2AkA.text: Very much a regular here for a couple of reasonsFirstly the service is excellent, no matter how busy the guys/girls are there to helpSecondly the bottles of wine and platters are great value for an evening of good conversation, great atmosphere, great quality and great price.Vodka Cocktails as the night kicks on are wicked. Lunches are good too but I do find them a touch on the higher side for good value. Still excellent quality but a not as good a value which is the only reason I am deducting half a star. 4.5 stars - highly recommend

todYx1SltKfa_aVIUQHaJQ.text: Came here on a Monday night, and this place was bathed in red light, from the red lanterns on top. Felt like I was in a bad Hong Kong movie circa 1980s. So, the food. I didn't have any drinks 'cept water here. I had an Awesome vegetarian salad, which wasn't super awesome in terms of taste, but awesome in terms of size. It was HUGE! On a bed of mesclun greens, was half an avocado, a boiled egg, some grilled eggplant (which they substituted my hated bell peppers out with), tomatoes, and brie cheese. I found the salad impossible to eat alone, and my companion had to help me out. The salad was also bathed in a very oily dressing, which I quickly tired of.After my very huge salad, I wanted something sweet, so bread and butter pudding it was. Nothing to shout about, 3/5. I did like the ambience here, with the remodelled school desks, retro yet industrial feel, but the red lights.have.got.to.stop.

raw5hmActt4Hk5xck4juZg.text: My new favorite spot for an awesome salad, it has Duck Rillettes, smoked Salmon and herb chicken on fresh greens. Authentic French cafe!! The owner Franck cane around checked on us and treated us to a complimentary piece of cake as a treat. They have free wifi so I finished some work over an iced Latte. It doesn't get much better,I will be back weekly!

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My amazing late by Franck!
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My awesome Brunch :)

s-EK1Zm3-ALEmzHR6rgEVQ.text: I guess three times is the charm. My two previous visits were two to forget, but the place is outside my front door and one of few in the neighbourhood open on Sundays; out of convenience Ihad to give it one more try. Service was prompt and the food was good.  The ambiance is excellent and the popularity of the place,  and the fact that it was in a startup phase,  might have something to do with my previous poor experiences of the place. The proprietor seems to have managed to get a stable and properly trained staff.  I'll be back again.

7XH1M9H1SVLe_46gLpx_-g.text: Had walked past this place a few times and read about it online but had never had the chance to visit. Actually, my first thought when I heard about this place was "what a corny name for a cafe". The Chinese name is a literal translation, which doesn't really help... But maybe they are trying to be ironic in a hipster way that I'll never understand? But corny name aside, the food was good, so I shan't harp on it.We had the My Awesome Salad and the Parma Ham Sandwich (with brie added on). I loved the sandwich, the bread was soft and warm, yet crispy on the sides. They were generous with their ingredients and it was very tasty. Same for the salad, it came with a large serving of smoked salmon, roasted chicken and tuna mayonnaise. My only gripe was that the avocado was a bit raw. We were here after spin class down the road so it was a good thing that their food portions were huge- we were starving! It was a good deal and really unexpected as each dish is only about $15-20 on average.Decor is... Interesting. Red paper lanterns galore, high stools made of pipes, desks turned into dining tables. The air conditioning (either that or the very powerful fans) was adequate, but just barely. SUMMARY: quirky decor, very good bread, portions are huge for the price ($15-20). Would visit again!

24qJD1BHHG1Pg7IH-WQe5A.text: Amazing cafe!! The staff was great, super accommodating for a vegan and the frozen acai was delicious

photos.caption: Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

i_wjjurRmAIRuL76S-rtOg.text: Okay, I love the bread here so much I'm writing this review as I chow down.  This place just opened last week and they bake their own bread fresh every day!!  My chicken breast sandwich was as fresh as can be, tasty, and very reasonably priced.Besides their soft breads, this place has damn good service.  Just getting one of these two things at a cafe is rare in Singapore, so having both in the same place makes this place truly AWESOME.
